data.title: Oliver Platt Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Oliver Platt with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Second cousin once-removed to the late Diana, Princess of Wales

Also a distant cousin of Orson Welles

Did voice work on Sesame Street's 1999 film Cinderelmo as the Fairy GodPerson

Turned down a role on The Practice

Became friends with Huff costar Hank Azaria when they both attended Tufts University

Starred as Nathan Detroit in a 2009 Broadway revival of Guys and Dolls

His success in non-leading roles is powered by his enjoyment of them, as he notes that "there are aspects to being a character actor where you actually get offered more interesting roles" than lead work

A big fan of TV series ranging to Cake Boss to Friday Night Lights

Loves voice-recognition software

Awards

2011Independent Spirit Awards-Robert Altman Award: winner

2008Emmy-Outstanding Guest Actor in a Drama Series: nominated

2008Screen Actors Guild Awards-Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture: nominated

2007Screen Actors Guild Awards-Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Television Movie or Miniseries: nominated

2006Emmy-Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series: nominated

2005Emmy-Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series: nominated

2005Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Series, Miniseries or Motion Picture Made for Television: nominated

2001Emmy-Outstanding Guest Actor in a Drama Series: nominated
